reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Excellent accommodation and service. We were lucky enough to have 5 nights. Meals and wines a delight. We will be returning soon perhaps for a longer stay.
reviews.title: The real deal

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband & I are internationals living in Cape Town. We needed a winter weekend get-away and took this place up on their winter specials. We couldn't have been happier. it was a fantastic value for the money, gorgeous, peaceful location, and we were PAMPERED!
reviews.title: Would have paid alot more, wonderful getaway B & B!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2008, traveled with friends
reviews.text: + Little touches: turn down service, room stocked with goodies, cozy lounge area
reviews.title: An oasis in Wellington

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: + Go for the meals: We got this as part of the package but were skeptical if it would be a little cheap meal. We were shocked. My husband is a big eater and I like the finer gourmet. The food was filling & tasty. We were both pleased. Served by a romantic roaring fire with great wine, 4 courses. Wonderful
reviews.title: Simply outstanding

likes.liked: — Cleanliness, spaciousness and attention to detail
likes.disliked: — not much, although a couple of the rooms do not have great views

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: + Ask for breakfast in bed: We discovered they will bring it to you in a cart at the time of your choosing! They also serve light meals & platters by the pool!
reviews.title: Tranquil stay at Bovley Valley Retreat

likes.liked: — The scenery and the fantastic staff.
likes.disliked: — Nothing negative to say about the accommodation.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Had a great stay at this little gem of a guest house. We wanted somewhere where we could relax and forget about work and just read our books in peaceful surroundings.
reviews.title: perfect place to unwind just beautiful peace and tranquilty, will be back

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This guest house did not disappoint us, we had a wonderful welcome and our room was just perfect looking out onto the lavender fields and the beautiful valley, not forgetting our four poster bed with the best mattress!
reviews.title: this is where you need to be if you like to relax with a glass of wine

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2010, traveled with friends
reviews.text: I cant really fault this place just a few other guests so one day we had the swimming pool all to ourselves with an honesty bar and great lunch snacks what more could we ask for.
reviews.title: Great venue but food a big dissapointment

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2010, traveled solo
reviews.text: We ate on the beautiful stoop that night for dinner, Under the most amazing stars.Home cooked meals beautifully presented and we were asked if we had any special dietary requirements, The meal was lovely good quality and the Dunstone wine the shiraz was one of the best wines we have ever tasted.
reviews.title: A Hidden Gem near Wellington!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: You must go and visit the winery during your stay we had a great tour and heard how it all started, We loved the wine so much that we brought some to take back and have the details to buy some more in the UK.
reviews.title: A stunning place to relax and unwind

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife and I stayed for one nigh at Bovlei Valley Retreat. The location is super, being surround by mountains and vineyards. Accommodation was very comfortable and clean. We stayed in the Lavender Cottage, and little sprigs of lavender were placed all over. The cottage was well equipped and the bed was very comfortable.
reviews.title: Peaceful retreat

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We ate at the Stone Kitchen at the nearby Dunstone winery (which is part of the property). The food was good, the chef's skill and attention were evident. Unfortunately the service is poor, the waitress made many basic mistakes (mixing up wines, not asking how the food was, not bringing the bill when requested, the list goes on...). Hopefully this will be addressed as the food deserves better service.
reviews.title: Great Escape...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Tip: The Bovlei Valley Retreat is not associated with the Bovlei winery.
reviews.title: Don't Miss this One

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2011, traveled solo
reviews.text: We celebrated our wedding anniversary here in November and weren't disappointed. If you want to get away from it all then this is the place to go...it was wonderfully tranquil. We were really impressed by the service provided by all the staff, the cleanliness of the rooms, the food and wine..all superb. So good, that we've booked to stay again in January with friends.
reviews.title: Just heaven!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Really awesome; service was impecable; atmosphere wonderful. We cannot thank Abby, Rozanne and staff enough. My wife said "it is like being in our own house... just better".
reviews.title: Return to South African paradise

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We have just spent two nights at Bovlei in the Lavender room. Our experience from start to end was of genuine friendship with every possible luxury made available. Their eye for detail was excellent. We ate at Bovlei both nights and certainly couldn't criticise the standard of cuisine. Went on the dam walk, which should have taken around one hour but somehow we managed to extend it to two! Certainly got to know the surrounding vineyards.
reviews.title: Superb

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled solo
reviews.text: There was absolutely nothing we could fault. A perfect gem of a place.
reviews.title: Two night escape

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Due to commitments in Cape Town we were unable to extend our stay for another night but this will certainly be a place that we will recommend and revisit.
reviews.title: Peaceful Escape

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2012, traveled with friends
reviews.text: The usual 45 minute drive from Cape Town stretched into a two hour drive, due to heavy traffic. I finally reached Bovlei Valley Retreat after marveling at the glowing mountains while the sun set. I was warmly greeted and welcomed by Elzanne, who escorted me to the Honeysuckle room. The room was very clean, spacious, with a welcome bowl of fruit, lovely bathrobe, good bathroom amenities and a coffee making facility. Although I was late to enjoy the afternoon tea and goodies, Elzanne served fresh homemade scones with cream and coffee in the suite. The location is very quiet and you are guaranteed a peaceful sleep. Dinner in front of the fireplace was excellent - good food, wine and company. The staff are very friendly and go out of their way to make your experience a good one. Free Internet access is available only in the dining room area. Looking forward to returning soon!
reviews.title: I wish we stayed here longer than 2 days

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Described as a retreat we certainly felt it was as we drove home after a days outing to this wonderfull valley with superb views,
reviews.title: Peaceful and relaxing
